title: What is the most advanced piece of technology you've seen in your life? - Quora

response.answer_text: Question asked: What is a technological advancement you have seen in your life? LasersMan on the moonThe last commercial steam trainColour TelevisionMain frame computersHome ComputersPersonal ComputersMobile Smart PhonesThe InternetSocial MediaDiesel carsTurbocharged carsElectric vehiclesElectric racing cars - Formula-EAutonomous carsAudio Visual communication across the planet3 D printing at homeSingle Board computingHigh Speed trains - 125 MphRe-introduction of TramsRoadside animated advertising screensSETIComputer virusesThe International Space Station and cooperation with Russia and other countriesProbes on Mars and pictures taken close to Saturn, Pluto, Jupiter and their moonsDiscovery of other planetsA photography of a 20 miles rock 4 Billion miles awayMass recyclingCancer treatmentsArtificial InseminationCloning animals - Dolly the SheepElectrically assisted bicyclesA health monitor on my wristCamera DronesFlat screen TVs and Monitors (also curved and folding screens)All enough to give me a lifetime of fascination that is still increasing at the age of 60. I still hope to see in my lifetime - Cure for cancer and other major diseasesMan walking on MarsAlien life visiting openlyFree EnergyFaster than light travelWorld PeaceAbolition of warThe end of starvationTotal diversity and equality enforcedPersonal flying deviceTotally clean transport100% recycling by lawSpace toursHumans with built in computersAutomated crime preventionUndoing of pollutionWe all become vegan and perfectly healthySurvival without working, people volunteer to help othersSpiritual awareness by everyone instead of dated religionBreakdown of all political barriers and land borders, true democracyTime travel!I would like to thank you for asking this question, I have recently started mentoring a 21yr old IT Student at work and we have some intelligent conversations on this subject, which is very stimulating. “Life moves pretty fast. If you don’t stop and look around once in awhile, you could miss it” - Ferris Bueller.

Every piece of advanced technology is built on previous advances; for instance, digital cameras depend on microelectronics, optics, LED’s, CCD’s and advanced batteries (each one of which was it’s own impressive advance). However, given the frame of the question, I would vote for the satellite global positioning systems (GPS). To pull this off, you need to combine advanced technology in microelectronics, precision timekeeping, RF propagation, geodetics, rocketry, reliability, radiation hardness, battery technology, LED or LCD displays and materials technology. And it’s all the more impressive in that this technology has become massively and inexpensively available to everyone on Earth, becoming so ubiquitous that GPS is now just an assumed accessory for your smartphone.
